name: Red Flag Detection
description: Identifying early warning signs of manipulative individuals and toxic social structures before they can entrap you.

cards.title: Recognizing Social Manipulators
cards.description: Spotting individuals who exhibit toxic, controlling, or deceptive behaviors.
bulletpoints: Narcissistic traits that signal control-based relationships.
Gaslighting indicators used to distort your perception of reality.
Love-bombing and trauma bonding designed to create emotional dependency.

cards.title: Assessing Group Power Dynamics
cards.description: Understanding social hierarchies and how manipulation flows within them.
bulletpoints: Spotting enablers who reinforce toxic leadership.
Identifying false authority figures who control through intimidation.
Recognizing power shift indicators that signal impending social traps.

cards.title: Detecting Covert Psychological Warfare
cards.description: Recognizing subtle techniques used to pressure, coerce, or manipulate in social settings.
bulletpoints: Microaggressions that slowly erode confidence and self-trust.
Social isolation tactics that cut off external support networks.
Fear-based control mechanisms designed to induce compliance.

cards.title: Spotting Conditional Kindness
cards.description: Identifying when favors, praise, or generosity are being used as manipulation tools.
bulletpoints: Recognizing gifts as emotional debt traps.
Noticing approval that fluctuates based on control compliance.
Detecting guilt-laden generosity designed to extract future obligations.

cards.title: The Energy Drain Test
cards.description: Detecting individuals who leave you feeling exhausted, confused, or emotionally unstable.
bulletpoints: Recognizing emotional vampires who drain mental resources.
Tracking mood changes before and after interactions.
Identifying subconscious stress responses to covert toxicity.

cards.title: The 'Too Good to Be True' Pattern
cards.description: Understanding how excessive charm, admiration, or opportunity is often a setup for control.
bulletpoints: Recognizing future faking and false promises.
Detecting trust acceleration techniques designed to bypass critical thinking.
Spotting unrealistically perfect personas masking predatory intent.

cards.title: The 'Divide and Conquer' Strategy
cards.description: Identifying when a manipulator is intentionally turning people against each other.
bulletpoints: Spotting triangulation where the manipulator plays multiple sides.
Recognizing information distortion that creates unnecessary conflict.
Tracking patterns of social positioning and divide-based control.

cards.title: The Emotional Mirror Trick
cards.description: Detecting when someone is mimicking your emotions to create artificial closeness.
bulletpoints: Spotting excessive mirroring designed to lower defenses.
Noticing shifts where they reflect emotions but lack genuine depth.
Identifying rapport-building techniques used to fast-track trust.

cards.title: Forced Urgency and High-Pressure Tactics
cards.description: Recognizing when someone is creating artificial urgency to bypass rational thought.
bulletpoints: Detecting time-sensitive manipulations used to eliminate choice.
Recognizing emotional overwhelm tactics designed to induce compliance.
Understanding how high-pressure environments trigger impulsive decisions.

cards.title: The Reputation Sabotage Trap
cards.description: Identifying when someone is secretly undermining you while pretending to be an ally.
bulletpoints: Recognizing subtle character assassination attempts in casual conversation.
Noticing when compliments are backhanded or designed to seed doubt.
Tracking inconsistencies between public praise and private criticism.

cards.title: The ‘Shifting Goalposts’ Strategy
cards.description: Detecting when manipulators constantly change expectations to keep you off balance.
bulletpoints: Recognizing when success criteria are altered to maintain control.
Spotting unrealistic demands that keep you chasing validation.
Understanding how moving targets create chronic self-doubt.

cards.title: Manipulation Through Victimhood
cards.description: Recognizing when someone weaponizes their suffering to extract control.
bulletpoints: Detecting chronic victim narratives that deflect accountability.
Noticing when guilt is manufactured to manipulate responses.
Identifying exaggerated helplessness that demands emotional labor.

cards.title: The Coercive 'We' Language Trick
cards.description: Spotting when someone is falsely using collective identity to push their agenda.
bulletpoints: Recognizing forced inclusion tactics designed to manufacture obligation.
Noticing when 'we' statements are used for subtle compliance pressure.
Understanding how false unity rhetoric overrides individual autonomy.
